text: Wow, I can't believe they finally admitted it! I knew something was up all these years.
You're telling me! All the blue screens and updates were just part of the joke? That's some dedication to a prank.
They certainly had us all fooled. I guess that explains Clippy - the ultimate prankster sidekick!
I always knew Clippy was suspicious. It was way too eager to "help".
This explains so much! Now I can finally tell my friends I wasn't the only one who found it funny when Windows crashed during a presentation.
I think we've all had that experience. I remember trying to convince my boss that Windows was a comedy sketch platform.
Yeah, it's like a comedy of errors. Sometimes, the punchline was just a little delayed... like during a crucial project deadline.
I wonder if this means Windows will now be a collector's item. Time to dust off my Windows 95 box!
Don't forget Windows ME! That one was a masterpiece of comedic genius. The blue screen of death was the punchline to end all punchlines.
No, no, no. Windows Vista was the pinnacle of this elaborate prank. It was so absurdly hilarious, I can't believe we all fell for it!
I still have nightmares about trying to install Vista. At least now I can laugh about it instead of crying.
So what's next for Microsoft? Are they going to pivot into stand-up comedy or something? I mean, after a prank like this, they've got a solid future in humor.
I heard they're going to start focusing on their other products like Office. Rumor has it that the next version of PowerPoint will include a "stand-up comedy" template.
Oh man, imagine if they incorporate AI-generated humor into their products. It would be an endless stream of dad jokes and puns. I'm here for it.
That actually sounds amazing. I'd love to see Clippy come back with a vengeance, delivering AI-generated one-liners!
